snippet: Temperatures in Phoenix have reached at least 100 degrees for 31 consecutive days, stretching even the most elastic tolerance levels of residents there used to scorching summers.
abstract: Temperatures in Phoenix have reached at least 100 degrees for 31 consecutive days, and 100 degrees for nine consecutive days, stretching even the most elastic tolerance levels of residents there who are used to scorching summers.
lead_paragraph: Temperatures in Phoenix have reached at least 100 degrees for 31 consecutive days, stretching even the most elastic tolerance levels of residents there used to scorching summers.

headline.seo: Phoenix in the Grip of Unrelenting Heat
headline.main: Nine Straight Days of 110 or More: That’s Hot, Even for Phoenix
headline.print_headline: Nine Straight Days of 110 or More: That’s Hot, Even for Phoenix
